intro.mainTitle: Complete Guide to BIS Certification & CRS Registration in India

whatIsBIS.title: What is BIS Registration?
whatIsBIS.paragraph1: The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the national standards body of India, functioning under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution, Government of India. Its core responsibility is to ensure that products in the Indian market conform to specific quality, safety, and performance standards outlined in the Indian Standards (IS).
whatIsBIS.paragraph2: One of the most important schemes governed by BIS is the Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS) — a regulatory framework mandating product registration for certain categories, particularly electronic and IT goods.
whatIsBIS.paragraph3: BIS Certification provides a formal guarantee that the product complies with Indian safety and performance standards, which helps protect Indian consumers from unsafe or substandard products.

overview.title: What is CRS – Compulsory Registration Scheme?
overview.paragraph1: Launched in 2012, the Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS) is a product registration scheme under BIS that initially targeted electronic goods. Over the years, it has expanded to include a wide array of product categories such as electrical appliances, solar equipment, batteries, and more CRS is mandatory for notified products through Quality Control Orders (QCOs) issued by various ministries.
overview.paragraph2: CRS Registration ensures that any product covered under the scheme must be registered with BIS before it is sold, imported, or distributed in India.

eligibility.title: Eligibility Criteria for BIS CRS Registration

whoCanApply.title: Who Can Apply for BIS Certification Under CRS?
whoCanApply.description: To obtain a BIS certificate under the Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS), the applicant must meet specific eligibility requirements outlined by the Bureau of Indian Standards. These conditions ensure that only genuine manufacturers are permitted to register and label products with the BIS CRS logo.

manufacturer.description: Only the original manufacturer (not trader or reseller) of the product is eligible to apply.

location.requirement: Location Can Be Indian or Foreign
location.description: Both Indian manufacturers and international brands can apply.

air.description: Foreign manufacturers must appoint an AIR — either their Indian branch or a formally authorized third party.

testReports.description: The product must be tested at a BIS-recognized lab and meet the Indian Standard (IS) applicable.

documentation.description: All required documents must be submitted in prescribed formats (details in next section).

registration.description: A separate application must be filed for each product type, manufacturing location, and brand name.

air.title: Who is an Authorized Indian Representative (AIR)?
air.description: If you're a foreign manufacturer, BIS requires you to appoint an Authorized Indian Representative (AIR) as your official contact in India.

responsibilities.heading: AIR Responsibilities:
points: Acts as the legal representative of the foreign applicant
Handles all BIS communications and obligations on behalf of the manufacturer
Takes legal responsibility for compliance and documentation
Must not be a trader or reseller unless explicitly appointed by the manufacturer

air.agreement: The AIR must submit an agreement signed by both parties and must have an Indian address.

documents.title: Documents Required for BIS CRS Registration
documents.subtitle: List of documents required to obtain BIS CRS registration.
documents.paragraph1: The BIS CRS registration process is completely online but demands precise documentation for successful approval. Even minor errors in forms, formats, or file types can lead to rejections or delays.
documents.paragraph2: Proper documentation also ensures your bis certificate is processed faster and remains legally valid across compliance audits, customs checks, and marketplace approvals.

masterChecklist.title: Master Checklist: Documents Required for BIS CRS Registration

addressProof.notes: Factory lease, utility bill, or license

testReport.notes: Must be recent (within 90 days) and reference IS code

undertakings.notes: Includes liability, compliance, and product responsibility

authorizationLetter.notes: Authorizes AIR to act on their behalf

companyRegistration.notes: Proof of business registration (GST, ROC, etc.)

productLabels.notes: Must show BIS logo, IS standard, and registration space

registration.title: BIS CRS Registration Process: Step-by-Step Guide

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The BIS CRS registration is a fully online process conducted via the BIS Registration Portal. However, it's not just about uploading documents — it requires technical precision, regulatory understanding, and strict adherence to Indian Standards (IS).

stepByStep.title: Step-by-Step BIS CRS Process
stepByStep.description: Here's how the BIS certification journey unfolds under the CRS:

step1.heading: Step 1: Product Testing at BIS-Recognized Lab
points: Choose a lab from the BIS-approved list
Submit your product sample for testing under the relevant IS
Receive the final test report, formatted per BIS requirements

step2.heading: Step 2: Preparation of Documents
points: Gather all required documents (as detailed in Section 7)
Ensure correct naming, formatting, signatures, and dates
Create a product label mockup showing BIS logo space + IS standard

step3.heading: Step 3: Online Application Filing
points: Log in or register on the BIS CRS Portal (https://www.bis.org.in/)
Fill in key fields: product, model number, brand, manufacturing unit, and AIR (if applicable)
Upload all documents and test report in correct sections
Pay the government fee online

step4.heading: Step 4: Application Review by BIS
points: BIS reviews submitted documents and verifies lab reports
If any clarification is required, a query will be raised through the portal
Respond with appropriate documentation or explanations

step5.heading: Step 5: Grant of BIS Registration
points: If everything is in order, BIS issues the Registration Certificate
Your certificate will mention:
You must print this info on the product label or apply e-labelling

step6.heading: Step 6: Labeling and Distribution
points: All certified products must carry the:
Label must be printed or digitally embedded as per BIS guidelines
labelRequirements: IS code applicable to the product

stepByStep.queryNote: Queries must be cleared within 30 days or application will be auto-rejected.

eLabelling.title: E-Labelling Guidelines for BIS CRS Certified Products

whatIs.title: What is E-Labelling?
whatIs.description: E-labelling refers to the practice of displaying regulatory information electronically within a device rather than printing it on physical surfaces. Under the BIS Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS), certain products — particularly compact or digital devices — can present the BIS certificate details, standard mark, and IS code through their software interface or digital packaging.

guidelines.title: Official BIS Guidelines on E-Labelling (CMD 3/8:1/6975 dated 3 Dec 2015)

physicalLabel.description: Product box or external packaging must display the BIS CRS logo and registration details.

removableLabels.description: If products are shipped in bulk, a removable adhesive label on the outer package is acceptable.

noTools.description: Users must be able to access the e-label info without needing tools or accessories (e.g., SIM card removal not allowed).

secureProgramming.description: E-label info must be embedded in firmware/software, locked from modification by any third party.

menuAccess.description: Users must access the info in no more than 4 steps through the device's menu interface.
